verses.arabic: ٱقْتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلْقَمَرُ
verses.translation: The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh, and the moon is cleft asunder.

verses.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ ءَايَةً يُعْرِضُوا۟ وَيَقُولُوا۟ سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ
verses.translation: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
verses.transliteration: Wa-in yaraw ayatan yuAAridoowayaqooloo sihrun mustamirr

verses.arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا۟ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَهْوَآءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
verses.translation: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
verses.translation: There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them),
verses.transliteration: Walaqad jaahum mina al-anba-i mafeehi muzdajar

verses.arabic: حِكْمَةٌۢ بَـٰلِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ
verses.translation: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.

verses.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَىْءٍ نُّكُرٍ
verses.translation: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair,
verses.transliteration: Fatawalla AAanhum yawma yadAAu addaAAiila shay-in nukur

verses.arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُّنتَشِرٌ
verses.translation: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,
verses.transliteration: KhushshaAAan absaruhum yakhrujoonamina al-ajdathi kaannahum jaradun muntashir

verses.arabic: مُّهْطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ هَـٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
verses.translation: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.
verses.transliteration: MuhtiAAeena ila addaAAiyaqoolu alkafiroona hatha yawmun AAasir

verses.arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا۟ عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا۟ مَجْنُونٌ وَٱزْدُجِرَ
verses.translation: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.
verses.transliteration: Kaththabat qablahum qawmu noohinfakaththaboo AAabdana waqaloo majnoonun wazdujir

verses.arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَغْلُوبٌ فَٱنتَصِرْ
verses.translation: Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"

verses.arabic: فَفَتَحْنَآ أَبْوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٍ مُّنْهَمِرٍ
verses.translation: So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth.

verses.arabic: وَفَجَّرْنَا ٱلْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَٱلْتَقَى ٱلْمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
verses.translation: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.
verses.transliteration: Wafajjarna al-arda AAuyoonanfaltaqa almao AAala amrin qad qudir

verses.arabic: وَحَمَلْنَـٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَٰحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
verses.translation: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:

verses.arabic: تَجْرِى بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَآءً لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ
verses.translation: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!

verses.arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكْنَـٰهَآ ءَايَةً فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
verses.translation: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?

verses.arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
verses.translation: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
verses.transliteration: Walaqad yassarna alqur-ana liththikrifahal min muddakir

verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: The 'Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِى يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُّسْتَمِرٍّ
verses.translation: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
verses.transliteration: Inna arsalna AAalayhim reehansarsaran fee yawmi nahsin mustamirr

verses.arabic: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُّنقَعِرٍ
verses.translation: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).

verses.arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
verses.translation: But We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
verses.transliteration: Walaqad yassarna alqur-ana liththikrifahal min muddakir

verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
verses.translation: The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.

verses.arabic: فَقَالُوٓا۟ أَبَشَرًا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدًا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
verses.translation: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!
verses.transliteration: Faqaloo abasharan minna wahidannattabiAAuhu inna ithan lafee dalalinwasuAAur

verses.arabic: أَءُلْقِىَ ٱلذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنۢ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
verses.translation: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
verses.transliteration: Aolqiya aththikru AAalayhimin baynina bal huwa kaththabun ashir

verses.arabic: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَّنِ ٱلْكَذَّابُ ٱلْأَشِرُ
verses.translation: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!

verses.arabic: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَّهُمْ فَٱرْتَقِبْهُمْ وَٱصْطَبِرْ
verses.translation: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!
verses.transliteration: Inna mursiloo annaqatifitnatan lahum fartaqibhum wastabir

verses.arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلْمَآءَ قِسْمَةٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُّحْتَضَرٌ
verses.translation: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one's right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
verses.transliteration: Wanabbi/hum anna almaa qismatunbaynahum kullu shirbin muhtadar

verses.arabic: فَنَادَوْا۟ صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
verses.translation: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).

verses.arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَٰحِدَةً فَكَانُوا۟ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلْمُحْتَظِرِ
verses.translation: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
verses.transliteration: Inna arsalna AAalayhim sayhatanwahidatan fakanoo kahasheemi almuhtathir

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
verses.translation: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
verses.transliteration: Walaqad yassarna alqur-ana liththikrifahal min muddakir

verses.arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
verses.translation: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.

verses.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَّجَّيْنَـٰهُم بِسَحَرٍ
verses.translation: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-
verses.transliteration: Inna arsalna AAalayhim hasibanilla ala lootin najjaynahum bisahar

verses.arabic: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ
verses.translation: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
verses.transliteration: NiAAmatan min AAindina kathalikanajzee man shakar

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنذَرَهُم بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا۟ بِٱلنُّذُرِ
verses.translation: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيْفِهِۦ فَطَمَسْنَآ أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
verses.transliteration: Walaqad rawadoohu AAan dayfihifatamasna aAAyunahum fathooqoo AAathabeewanuthur

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُم بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُّسْتَقِرٌّ
verses.translation: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:

verses.arabic: فَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابِى وَنُذُرِ
verses.translation: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
verses.translation: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
verses.transliteration: Walaqad yassarna alqur-ana liththikrifahal min muddakir

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ
verses.translation: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).

verses.arabic: كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍ
verses.translation: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.

verses.arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٌ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
verses.translation: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?
verses.transliteration: Akuffarukum khayrun min ola-ikumam lakum baraatun fee azzubur

verses.arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُّنتَصِرٌ
verses.translation: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?

verses.arabic: سَيُهْزَمُ ٱلْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
verses.translation: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.

verses.arabic: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
verses.translation: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ وَسُعُرٍ
verses.translation: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِى ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا۟ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
verses.translation: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"
verses.transliteration: Yawma yushaboona fee annariAAala wujoohihim thooqoo massa saqar

verses.arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ خَلَقْنَـٰهُ بِقَدَرٍ
verses.translation: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَمْرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍۭ بِٱلْبَصَرِ
verses.translation: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.

verses.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَآ أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِن مُّدَّكِرٍ
verses.translation: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?

verses.arabic: وَكُلُّ شَىْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِى ٱلزُّبُرِ
verses.translation: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):

verses.arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُّسْتَطَرٌ
verses.translation: Every matter, small and great, is on record.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
verses.translation: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,

verses.arabic: فِى مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٍ مُّقْتَدِرٍۭ
verses.translation: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.
